info.name: Linux
info.desc: This is a course covering a lot of things about Linux. There are a lot of distributions of Linux such as Debian, Arch Linux, Ubuntu, Fedora, and so on...

info.name: PHP
info.desc: Almost everything you will use in PHP to make your website server-side in PHP.

info.name: Java
info.desc: The course is explaining a lot of concepts up to Java16, including graphical libraries like SWING, AWT, or JavaFX.

info.name: C
info.desc: We start from scratch and end up creating more complex programs with threads or a graphical interface.

info.name: Cybersecurity
info.desc: Everything related to the security of your accounts, applications, websites should be kept here.

info.name: Linux
info.desc: Learn how to survive in (or mastering) a Linux-based environment.

info.name: Assembly
info.desc: A short introduction to ARM assembly.

info.name: Node.js
info.desc: Learn how you could use node to handle server-side logic, creating an API, or even creating an application with electron.

info.name: Typescript
info.desc: Write once and compile in any version of JavaScript.

info.name: API
info.desc: An application programming interface (API) is an interface allowing a user to use someone else services without digging into the code.
